intro.paragraph1: I'm Mike, and this is my corner of the internet to share my passion for the night sky. Here I share my new successes and don't shy away from past failures, to document my progress in the hobby and show that it's more accessible than it seems when looking at the results of experienced photographers.

journey.title: The Journey
journey.paragraph1: I've always been fascinated with the night sky and the photos other people take, and finally have decided to pull the plug and give it a go myself in late Fall of 2024. Mostly with the stuff I already had: a Sony camera and a long telephoto zoom, aside from the entry-level Skywatcher GoTo mount. I quickly got hooked on the process and realized I wanted more, and so began the road into astrophotography that lies through bankruptcy.
journey.paragraph2: Currently based in the UAE, I'm fortunate to have access to dark skies and clear nights most of the year, even if I have to drive pretty far out of the city.
journey.paragraph3: My primary locations are the test site at the
journey.paragraph3b: , a light polluted place, but close to home, and the main shooting site at
journey.paragraph3c: , the darkest place in the country.
journey.paragraph4: Besides that, I also shoot from my apartment balcony, in heavy city light pollution. While not ideal, that keeps me motivated and connected to the hobby I would otherwise not be able to practice as often.
